content: what is the best way to come up to speed on clinFHIR, in particular on creating new Resources or extensions.

For now we're using the conMan tool (though it's going to be be re-branded soon - not everyone shares my sense of humour!) - I've created an instance at http://conman.clinfhir.com/connectathon.html?event=atlanta2019 - click the 'clinical' button at the top left to see the ones for COF.

For documentation, there a documentation tab in the app (far right) and a number of posts I've made over the years - https://fhirblog.com/?s=conman . If you have specific questions, or would like a walk through just ask here or in the clinFHIR stream...
Is there going to be a Clinicians on FHIR meeting at the upcoming Working Group? The first few WGs I attended there was a meeting on Friday; but it's been MIA the past couple of conferences.
Yes, here is the agenda for Atlanta, https://confluence.hl7.org/display/PC/Fall+2019+-+Atlanta+-+Clinician-on-FHIR
